heading: techtile design
subheading: a collection of eye-swirling patterns, intense colors, and oh-so-subtle gradations, helle abild’s new family of designs displays the potential of digital printing technologies. the traditional printing process limits most jobs to 15 different colors. abild, a danish-born, san francisco-based designer, used a stork inkjet textile printer that can handle more than 16 million. a few […]
author: jessie scanlon
text: a collection of eye-swirling patterns, intense colors, and oh-so-subtle gradations, helle abild's new family of designs displays the potential of digital printing technologies. the traditional printing process limits most jobs to 15 different colors. abild, a danish-born, san francisco-based designer, used a stork inkjet textile printer that can handle more than 16 million. a few of abild's creations have been selected for the  international design yearbook 2000. plus, a few were bought by dupont, which, as a major producer of inks and fibers, has a natural interest in printing technology. and just to emphasize that this is the wave of the future, abild calls her line of patterns the y2k quilt.electric wordshooting starshall of soundneed a hand?through the looking glasstechtile designplug and play
